name: Renegade Row (Hands on Dumbbells or Floor)
setup: High plank with hands on dumbbells (hex DBs preferred) or on floor
Feet set wider than hips for stability
Wrists stacked under shoulders; squeeze glutes and brace
steps: Shift weight slightly to the planted hand without rotating
Row the opposite dumbbell toward ribs, keeping elbow close
Pause and squeeze the back; lower with control
Repeat on the other side, maintaining square hips throughout
mistakes: Hips twisting or rotating to the side
Rowing too fast and losing control
safety: Prefer flat, non-rolling dumbbells if loading heavy. If wrists bother you, perform from fists on floor or elevate hands to a box/bench.

prescriptionHints.load: DBs 10–40 lb each to start; pick load that lets you resist rotation
prescriptionHints.notes: Set feet wide enough to keep hips square. Quality over load.

joints.notes: Keep neutral spine and packed shoulders; elevate hands if wrist extension is limited.
